Geger Anggaran Lem Aibon Rp 82 M di DKI, Sri Mulyani Turun Tangan
02 Nov 2019, 01:00 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Foto: Profil Sri Mulyani (Fauzan Kamil/Infografis detikcom)

Jakarta - Munculnya anggaran 'aneh' dalam Kebijakan Umum Anggaran-Prioritas Plafon Anggaran Sementara (KUA-PPAS) 2020 Pemerintah Provinsi DKI Jakarta tengah jadi sorotan publik. KUA-PPAS ini nantinya menjadi Anggaran Pendapatan dan Belanja Daerah (APBD) 2020.Keanehan anggaran ini terungkap ketika Anggota DPRD DKI Fraksi PSI, William Aditya Sarana menyoroti anggaran lem Aibon senilai Rp 82 miliar di Suku Dinas Pendidikan Wilayah I Jakarta Barat. Ada pula anggaran ballpoint Rp 124 miliar jadi pertanyaan PSI.Selain ballpoint, ada juga anggaran kertas Rp 213 miliar, tinta printer Rp 400 miliar, stabilo Rp 3 miliar, penghapus Rp 31 miliar dan Rp 31 miliar kalkulator. Kontroversi anggaran ini menyita perhatian Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati. Sri Mulyani mengatakan bakal ikut turun tangan untuk meningkatkan kualitas anggaran daerah. The commotion of the Aibon Glue budget of Rp. 82 billion in DKI, Sri Mulyani Down
02 Nov 2019, 01:00 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Photo: Profile of Sri Mulyani (Fauzan Kamil / Infographic detikcom)

Jakarta - The emergence of a 'strange' budget in the 2020 Provisional Budget Ceiling (KUA-PPAS) General Policy The Provincial Government of DKI Jakarta is in the public spotlight. This KUA-PPAS will later become the 2020 Regional Revenue and Expenditure Budget (APBD). This budget's peculiarity was revealed when PSI DKI DPRD Member William Aditya Sarana highlighted the Aibon glue budget of Rp. 82 billion in the West Jakarta Region I Education Department. There is also a ballpoint budget of Rp 124 billion, so PSI questions. Besides the ballpoint, there is also a paper budget of Rp 213 billion, printer ink of Rp 400 billion, Rp 3 billion highlighter, eraser of Rp 31 billion and Rp 31 billion of calculators. This budget controversy caught the attention of the Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati. Sri Mulyani said that she would intervene to improve the quality of the regional budget.
